value:
To think me the blushing bride, and
in such foreign attire, no less! P'raps
Yen'fay would celebrate all the same.

Restoring Chon'sin, my homeland, to
its former glory is of the utmost
import. 'Tis a task rife with hardship.$k$pFor that reason, I am most eager to
acquire a partner prepared to assist
me in this vital campaign.

'Tis my first time donning garments
such as these. I beseech you...
Would you say they suit me?

A princess I may be, but Chon'sin is
naught but a meager kingdom. 'Tis no
surprise we need care for ourselves.

Wheat and rice look to have much in
common. Could one then assume
bread might be made using rice?

In the spirit of the bridal festival,
please accept this small gift in honor
of the celebration. May it impart joy.

Even in the throes of battle I've
pondered what it is to love...and
suddenly it's struck me!$k$pKnowing you would lay down your
very life for another, that is love. 'Tis
an everlasting fount of daring.

Heed not my attire, lest you mistake
me for anything other than your
deadliest foe, a warrior of Chon'sin.

P'raps I lack the adoration
necessary to play the bride...

Ah, you share this joy with me that
I might use it as my own. Together,
we shall create a cycle of bliss.

'Tis with a happy heart that I join in
this festival. I may not grasp all of the
customs, but I attend with all sincerity.

I had no notion of what to expect
from this festival, so my heart is full
of gratitude at your presence here.$k$pI would have truly felt out of sorts
without you at my side. That is to
say... My home is quite different.$k$pIn the spring, the kingdom of
Chon'sin is teeming with thousands
of blooming cherry trees and florals.$k$p'Tis the springtime when families
gather under the blooms to celebrate
marriage and exchange solemn vows.$k$pI have long imagined drinking from
the three nuptial cups—past, present,
future—and declaring my eternal love.$k$pI suppose 'tis not too dissimilar from
this festival. In the end, all I wish is
for a partner to share in life's trials.$k$pIf I may, p'raps you would enlighten
me on customs of your land...and
your ideal partner?
Ready?
By your side!
Let us seek happiness.
Accept my love!
A dream, is it not?
Unprepared...
I am Say'ri. I may yet have much to learn, but I pray this relationship brings us both happiness.
Fie! Do not surprise me while I wear such unfamiliar raiments.
I am not yet well prepared to marry. I am well prepared to fight, however.
The Voice in bridal garb... 'Tis a sight that stirs the heart.
I would like to show my homeland to whomever I end up marrying.
I wonder... Should I marry, would Yen'fay be happy for me?
Tell me, what do you think of this attire? It suits me? I am pleased to hear it.
On your order.
There are uncertainties…
I shall follow.
